author: Vivian Sahner
title: IAM members strike Boeing plants in Missouri, Illinois, seek higher wages
text:
Some 3,200 members of International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers District 837 went on strike Aug. 4 at three Boeing facilities in Missouri and Illinois, after voting down the company‚Äôs second inadequate contract offer in two weeks. The workers build and maintain fighter jets, including the F-15 and F/A-18 models, and will build the new F-47.
I‚Äôm prepared to strike for as ‚Äúlong as it takes,‚Äù Lathaniel Johnson, an assembly mechanic at Boeing in Berkeley, Missouri, told St. Louis Public Radio. The company‚Äôs offer of a 20% wage increase over four years, he said, was not enough.
The company‚Äôs second offer did take out its unpopular demand for new schedules of four consecutive 10-hour weekdays or three consecutive 12-hour Friday-to-Monday shifts. Union members made clear that wasn‚Äôt happening.
Some 30 strikers lined up along Airport Road outside the Boeing facility in Berkeley Aug. 4. ‚ÄúWe feel entirely that it‚Äôs just completely inadequate,‚Äù Earl Schussler, 59, a longtime Boeing worker told the St. Louis Post-Dispatch. He explained that workers made concessions in 2014 after the company threatened to leave St. Louis. ‚ÄúNow look at us today.‚Äù
In March, Boeing was awarded a $20 billion contract to build the Air Force‚Äôs ‚Äúnext-generation‚Äù F-47. Last week Boeing reported $22.7 billion in revenue for its latest financial quarter, its largest revenue figure in six years. About 30% of Boeing‚Äôs revenue comes from its military and space division.
Dan Gillian, a vice president and general manager for Boeing, told the press the company will continue to work with ‚Äúour nonstriking workforce.‚Äù According to a statement by the AFL-CIO urging support for the strike, the company has already announced plans to hire ‚Äúreplacement workers.‚Äù
Solidarity with the Boeing strike!

author: @NuevaMujer
title: "Luce tan acabado": captan a Justin Bieber junto a Hailey pero su aspecto impacta y preocupa a fans
text:
Desde hace un tiempo la apariencia de Justin Bieber est√° generando preocupaci√≥n a sus fan√°ticas. Los paparazzi han fotografiado al cantante desali√±ado, con barba descuidada y una mirada cansada. Adem√°s de estar m√°s delgado de lo que ya era.
PUBLICIDAD
De acuerdo a algunos medios, los cambios en su aspecto f√≠sico podr√≠an tener diversas causas, entre ellas los problemas que enfrenta en su matrimonio con Hailey Bieber.
Se rumora que la pareja est√° atravesando una crisis y que la modelo estar√≠a considerando separarse debido al comportamiento destructivo de su esposo.
Contra todos los rumores siguen juntos
Pese a los rumores de separaci√≥n, la pareja se fue de vacaciones a Aspen para pasar el A√±o Nuevo juntos. De regreso a la rutina Justin y Hailey fueron vistos en las calles de Nueva York con looks que ser√°n tendencia e inspiraci√≥n este 2025.
Sin embargo, m√°s all√° de su estilo, lo que m√°s llam√≥ la atenci√≥n fue ver al cantante con un cambio de look, pues dej√≥ de lado los gorros y sombreros para mostrar su nuevo corte de pelo.
Seg√∫n la revista Hola, el interprete de ‚ÄúBaby baby‚Äù apost√≥ por su pieza go-to, una hoodie de corte oversized en amarillo mantequilla que combin√≥ con un par de pantalones beige que m√°s tarde intercambi√≥ por una sudadera roja y un par de pants deportivos con una franja azul a los lados.
Para la noche, Bieber accesoriz√≥ su look con un beanie azul que hizo match con la franja de su pantal√≥n. Pese a su nuevo look, el cantante despide un aura de depresi√≥n que ha encendido las alarmas justo en medio de un proceso doloroso que podr√≠a desembocar en un divorcio de su esposa Hailey, de 28 a√±os.
PUBLICIDAD
A Hailey le prest√≥ la maternidad
En cambio a la fundadora de Rhode, la maternidad le sent√≥ muy bien, y su estilo ha evolucionado con ella pero se mantiene din√°mico y divertido.
La modelo sali√≥ junto a Justin con un atuendo que juega con diferentes tonos neutros. Combin√≥ un par de pantalones de vestir beige, con una gabardina del mismo color, complement√≥ con una cl√°sica t-shirt blanca que elev√≥ con un su√©ter de botones y una pashmina alrededor del cuello.
Lleva por supuesto, un par de gafas oscuras y su calzado insignia, un par de mocasines.

author: Matt Hoenig
title: Snowboarder narrowly escapes avalanche in Tuckerman Ravine
text: A snowboarder narrowly escaped a human-triggered avalanche in Tuckerman Ravine on Wednesday morning.A video from the summit of Wildcat Mountain shows the snowboarder outrunning the avalanche by seconds.Experts said Tuesday's freezing temperatures likely contributed to the snow sliding.>> Download the free WMUR app to get updates on the go: Apple | Google Play <<Avalanches are more common this time of year as winter transitions to spring. They can be triggered by new or soft snow, rapidly warming temperatures, and gusty winds.Step slopes remain prone to avalanches throughout the winter, including areas on Mount Washington such as Eastern Snowfields, Huntington Ravine, Tuckerman Ravine, Hillman's Highway and Gulf of Slides.So far this season, about 60 avalanches have been recorded, including 41 in February.

author: Anonym
title: Premier League: Arsenal fall to West Ham and miss chance to take the lead - The Limited Times
text:
A small feat for West Ham and a setback for the Gunners! By winning (0-2) at the Emirates Stadium, Alphonse Areola and his teammates stunned Arsenal on Thursday evening, at the end of the 19th day of the Premier League.
The Gunners needed to win to move ahead of Liverpool, take the lead in the league and at the same time distance Manchester City and Unai Emery's Aston Villa. But Mikel Arteta's men lacked realism as evidenced by the statistics of the match: 74.2% possession in their favour, 30 shots including eight on target, compared to only six including three on target for their opponents.
Against them, the West Ham players were able to be opportunistic by scoring at the start of the first half on a counter initiated by former Lyon player Lucas Paqueta and finished by Tomas Soucek (13‚Ä≤). The referees hesitated to validate it, checking if the ball had not gone out to the left of the goal on the pass before the goal but ended up awarding it.
In the second half, it was from a corner and thanks to a header from a former Arsenal player, Konstantinos Mavropanos, well helped by the post and the crossbar (55'), that West Ham made the break. The Hammers could even have finished off their opponents with a penalty in the dying seconds, saved by David Raya.
Mavropanos bends Arsenal again! üî¥
The former Gunner's header hits the bar and then the post before going into goal and it's 2-0 for West Ham ‚öíÔ∏è #WHUARS | #PremierLeague pic.twitter.com/skos017mBc
‚Äî CANAL+ Foot (@CanalplusFoot) December 28, 2023
Tottenham end their run at Brighton Having struggled away from home in recent weeks, the Hammers have made a very good move in the race for European qualification. West Ham are in sixth place in the Premier League table thanks to this win and are ahead of Manchester United.
Earlier in the evening, the other match of this 19th matchday of the Premier League saw Brighton surprise Tottenham in a very fast-paced match (4-2). Spurs, who were on a three-game winning streak, were unable to catch up after two goals from Jack Hinshelwood (11') and Joao Pedro (23' from the penalty spot).
They lost all hope after third and fourth goals from Pervis Estupinan (63‚Ä≤) and Joao Pedro (75‚Ä≤, again from the penalty spot), despite the reductions of the score by Alejo Veliz (81‚Ä≤) and Ben Davies (85‚Ä≤). Tottenham are in fifth place in the table.

author: @marieclairearg
title: Tendencias verano 2024: descubr√≠ la nueva colecci√≥n de moda de Joti Harriague inspirada en el mar | Marie Claire
text:
La temporada de verano 2024 estall√≥ en Punta del Este donde las celebridades y figuras importantes de la moda est√°n disfrutando del sol y las playas m√°s destacadas de Uruguay . En el inicio de esta temporada, Joti Harriague junto a S√≠ntesis Design present√≥ su nueva colecci√≥n de joyas ‚ÄúSirens by the sea‚Äù inspirada en el mar en Laguna Escondida, Jos√© Ignacio.
La colecci√≥n de Joti Harriague se inspira en los colores y elementos del mar
Este nuevo proyecto de la dise√±adora abarca una paleta de colores fuertes que impactar√°n en la temporada Verano 2024. El blanco , el lila , el verde y el borravino son los colores que se destacaron en la presentaci√≥n de la nueva colecci√≥n.
La luminosidad de los rayos del sol se encuentra en las prendas Esta gama de tonos est√° inspirada en los colores del mar , basando toda la tem√°tica en el oc√©ano. Al igual que el movimiento de las olas y los rayos del sol, esta colecci√≥n que surge del mar juega con transmitir el arte y la magia de las profundidades.
"Sirens by the sea" fue presentada en Jos√© Ignacio, Punta del Este El evento presentaci√≥n de la nueva colecci√≥n cont√≥ con la presencia de grandes figuras de la moda y el arte como Zaira Nara, P√≠a Slapka, Emilia Attias, Sabrina Garciarena, Angelita landaburu, Daniela Urzi, Puli de Mar√≠a, Titi V√°zquez y Vito Sarabia.
El cuero se suma a las prendas de la dise√±adora
La nueva propuesta de Joti Harriague junto a S√≠ntesis Design cont√≥ con las √∫ltimas tendencias de la moda como lo es el cuero, las intervenciones en las prendas y el estilo artesanal . Las transparencias, los brillos, te√±idos y corseter√≠a de vanguardia fueron otras de las tendencias que estuvieron presentes en la colecci√≥n.
Los tajos, brillos y transparencias se destacan en la colecci√≥n de Joti Harriague Adem√°s, estuvo presente la l√≠nea de zapatos que acompa√±a a la perfecci√≥n al dramatismo de las prendas y sus colores. Las botas altas taco aguja son las piezas m√°s destacadas de esta l√≠nea junto con los tajos.
Redes en las prendas, accesorios con dise√±os mar√≠timos y wet look
Joti acostumbr√≥ a su p√∫blico a ganas de m√°s. Su talento y vanguardismo son la clave de sus dise√±os y se ajustan a la perfecci√≥n con su nueva colecci√≥n presentada en Laguna Escondida. Junto a la ropa y los zapatos, la dise√±adora exhibi√≥ en la pasarela las joyas S√≠ntesis Design, una colecci√≥n impactante de piezas exclusivas. Esta marca nueva y de alto impacto que deslumbra a todos con su estilo innovador y lujoso. Cada pieza realizada por la autora Isabel Etchebarne y due√±a de la marca en este espectacular desfile.
Las vias de contacto de Joti Harriague es el sitio web https://www.jotiharriague.com/ y https://www.sintesisdesign.com.ar/ donde exhibe sus prendas m√°s exclusivas y est√° su tienda online. Adem√°s, para m√°s informaci√≥n est√° disponible su cuenta de Instagram @ JOTI.HARRIAGUE y @sintesisdesign .
Galer√≠a de im√°genes Acced√© a los beneficios para suscriptores Contenidos exclusivos Sorteos Descuentos en publicaciones Participaci√≥n en los eventos organizados por Editorial Perfil. Suscribite ahora Compart√≠ esta Nota

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: The digital currency platform Enet Crypto Center Limited successfully obtained the U.S. Fincen MSB license, legalizing and regularizing transactions. | User | times-online.com
text: On December 20th, after submitting proof of MSB registration completion, Enet Crypto Center Limited (hereinafter referred to as Enet) officially obtained the U.S. Fincen MSB license on November 15. This marks a further step in Enet's compliance journey, allowing it to legally conduct currency exchange business in the United States, further expanding its international development space. This establishes a solid foundation for serving global users and enables Enet to provide users with safer, compliant, efficient, and convenient digital economic transaction services Since 2018, the U.S. Department of Treasury and the Securities and Exchange Commission have repeatedly emphasized that MSBs (Money Services Businesses) include virtual currency exchanges and their managers. The regulated entities are businesses and companies related to financial services. The regulatory scope includes international remittances, foreign exchange, currency trading, ICO issuance, and management of prepaid projects. Operating digital asset-related business within the United States requires a license. Hence, Enet‚Äôs possession of the license grants it legal status in the U.S., distinguishing it from other irregular platforms. Enet Exchange has always sought higher-level and broader development. As a global leader in decentralized exchanges, it is committed to breaking national boundaries and achieving global integration. Based on Enet's public blockchain technology, it aims to realize scenario implementations in various fields, including capital, digital asset management, digital asset payment, blockchain charity, blockchain gaming, blockchain entertainment, blockchain shopping, and blockchain community games, thereby creating a complete decentralized digital asset ecosystem. Holding a license is of great significance for current exchanges. Obtaining official permission from the respective countries reflects the strength and credibility of the exchange. For most exchanges, a license also acts as a natural barrier for selection. For users, Enet's compliant operation under regulatory conditions is a major advantage, meaning their investments will receive legal protection. Under official permission, Enet strictly meets local regulatory requirements and user protection regulations. Enet will continue to advance its compliance and globalization development, providing safe and convenient digital asset transaction services to more global users. It also calls on other platforms to join the regular development path, contributing to the industry's progress and hoping to achieve industry compliance consensus. Disclaimer: The information provided in this press release is not a solicitation for investment, or intended as investment advice, financial advice, or trading advice. It is strongly recommended that you practice due diligence (including consultation with a professional financial advisor) before investing in or trading securities and cryptocurrency. Media Contact Company Name: Enet Crypto Center Limited Contact Person: Roger Brown Email: Send Email Country: United States Website: https://enetcoin.cc/

author: Jackie Wattles
title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy launches X-37B plane, one of the US military‚Äôs most fascinating secrets
text:
Sign up for CNN‚Äôs Wonder Theory science newsletter. Explore the universe with news on fascinating discoveries, scientific advancements and more .
CNN ‚Äî SpaceX‚Äôs hulking Falcon Heavy rocket returned to the skies Thursday evening, and this time it launched a mysterious spacecraft for the US military that will carry out cutting-edge research.
The rocket lifted off from NASA‚Äôs Kennedy Space Center in Florida at 8:07 p.m. ET, carrying the military‚Äôs X-37B space plane ‚Äî which is uncrewed and operates autonomously ‚Äî to unprecedented altitudes. The launch streamed live on SpaceX‚Äôs website . The side boosters returned to Earth and safely touched down.
It is not clear, however, exactly where the space plane is going.
See more The X-37B‚Äôs activities in space have long been the subject of fascination and speculation in the space community as amateur enthusiasts race to track its whereabouts and share theories about its activities.
Resembling a miniature NASA space shuttle with the windows blacked out, the reusable and fully autonomous X-37B has been known to carry out research on concepts such as relaying solar energy from space for use back on Earth and studying the effects of radiation on seeds used to grow food.
And this mission ‚Äî the seventh trip to space for an X-37B plane ‚Äî promises to be even more intriguing than earlier flights.
Staff Sgt. Adam Shanks/US Space Force The X-37B orbital test vehicle concludes its sixth successful mission in 2022. A powerful ride This launch marked the first time the space plane has hitched a ride on a SpaceX Falcon Heavy, one of the most powerful operational rockets in the world.
Previously, the X-37B has launched on the SpaceX Falcon 9 vehicle and the Atlas V rocket built by United Launch Alliance, a joint venture between Lockheed Martin and Boeing.
The Falcon Heavy produces more thrust than both of those rockets combined.
Thom Baur/Reuters NASA's Lucy spacecraft, atop a United Launch Alliance Atlas 5 rocket for a mission to study the Trojan asteroids in the outer solar system, launches from Pad-41 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station, in Cape Canaveral, Florida, October 16, 2021. REUTERS/Thom Baur These 2023 science and exploration missions seemed like fiction
The launch via the Falcon Heavy could indicate that X-37B is destined for more distant orbits, perhaps even to the moon or Mars, suggested Paul Graziani, CEO of COMSPOC, a company dedicated to tracking objects in space.
If it does travel much deeper into the cosmos than earlier flights, it could be far more difficult for sky-gazers on Earth to determine where the vehicle is.
If the military doesn‚Äôt want people to track the X-37B, Graziani added, the vehicle can be hidden in the glare of the sun or by various other means ‚Äî including changing its position often. The X-37B has already proven on previous flights that it‚Äôs capable of making multiple maneuvers in space.
COMSPOC will attempt to search for the vehicle if the spacecraft winds up in geosynchronous orbit, which lies about 22,400 miles (36,000 kilometers) from Earth and is where most massive communications satellites operate. Geosynchronous orbit is where the company focuses its sensors for tracking satellites, said Graziani and Bob Hall, COMSPOC‚Äôs director of operations integration.
See more ‚ÄúI think it‚Äôs one of the most interesting things that‚Äôs happened in space in a long time, whatever it‚Äôs going to do,‚Äù Graziani said of the X-37B launch.
Space technology innovations The X-37B makes it possible for the United States to carry out experiments to understand how to improve ongoing and upcoming space operations and push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible, according to a statement by Gen. B. Chance Saltzman, chief of space operations.
Among the research on board this mission is a NASA experiment that aims to find ways to sustain astronauts on future deep-space missions. Called Seeds-2, it will ‚Äúexpose plant seeds to the harsh radiation environment of long-duration spaceflight‚Äù and build on research carried out on previous X-37B missions.
Learning how to grow food in the harsh, soilless environment of outer space could be crucial for astronauts on lengthy missions to the moon or beyond ‚Äî places where it‚Äôs more difficult to deliver fresh supplies.
Space Solar An illustration of the UK-designed CASSIOPeiA solar power satellite. Space-based solar power involves harvesting sunlight from Earth orbit then beaming it down to the surface where it is needed. This wild, futuristic space plan could help save the world. But some say it‚Äôs too far-fetched
It‚Äôs unclear how long the spacecraft will spend in orbit for this stint, though historically each X-37B flight has been longer than the last.
The last trip to space for the autonomous X-37B concluded in November 2022 after the spacecraft logged nearly 909 consecutive days in space. During that sixth mission, as CNN previously reported, the space plane carried experimental technology designed by the US Navy to convert solar energy and transmit it back to the ground , according to the military.
The X-37B has already spent more than 3,700 days in space on other uncrewed missions. When it returns to Earth, it will land on a runway, much like an airplane swooping down from the skies.
Challenging China This launch came after more than two weeks of delays. SpaceX was prepared to lift off on December 10. The launch was pushed off twice because of weather and issues with the ground pad before SpaceX abruptly delayed the mission indefinitely to ‚Äúperform additional system checkouts.‚Äù
But during the downtime, China ‚Äî which the US government considers its chief competitor in a modern space race ‚Äî sent its own secretive spacecraft into orbit.
Little about the spacecraft from China is known. Some in the industry speculate it is a doppelganger of the X-37B in form and function, though no official photos of the vehicle have been released.
China‚Äôs state-run Xinhua News Agency reported that the clandestine spacecraft launched aboard a Long March 2F rocket.
The agency‚Äôs post added only that during its stay in space, the vehicle will test out reusable space technology and carry out unspecified science experiments ‚Äúfor the peaceful use of space.‚Äù
It is not clear how long China‚Äôs space plane will spend in orbit.

author: EFE
title: ¬´Hicieron trampa, la peor trampa del mundo¬ª, lamenta una venezolana tras cruzar el Dari√©n
text:
[]https://elnacional.com.do/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/EFE_0021535752.jpg
LAJAS BLANCAS (PANAM√Å), 26/09/2024.- Migrantes venezolanos descansan en la Estaci√≥n Temporal de Recepci√≥n Migratoria (ETRM) este jueves, en Lajas Blanca en Dari√©n (Panam√°). EFE/ Bienvenido Velasco
Moncho Torres |
Lajas Blancas (Panam√°).- Los venezolanos siguen siendo mayor√≠a entre los migrantes que atraviesan la selva del Dari√©n, la frontera natural entre Panam√° y Colombia, rumbo a Norteam√©rica, y algunos de ellos hablan de ¬´la peor trampa del mundo¬ª, despu√©s de que el pasado 28 de julio en las elecciones en Venezuela se proclam√≥, sin que se difundieran las actas, la victoria del mandatario Nicol√°s Maduro.
‚ÄúAy, hicieron trampa, la peor trampa del mundo¬ª, dec√≠a este jueves a EFE la venezolana Johanna Calanche, de 23 a√±os, junto a su peque√±o de 4, instalados en una caba√±a de madera en un centro paname√±o de recepci√≥n de migrantes, a donde se llega en canoa por el r√≠o Tuquesa tras cruzar durante varios d√≠as la selva.
La joven explica que durante la jornada electoral en Venezuela apoy√≥ en la log√≠stica a la oposici√≥n preparando comida, y que como ‚Äúno quer√≠an dar los resultados‚Äù, se retir√≥ cansada y se acost√≥.
‚ÄúY lo que escuch√© fue como a la 1 de la madrugada que mi esposo me toc√≥ los pies y me dice: ‚ÄòNegra, nos vamos a tener que ir otra vez‚Äô. Y le digo, ‚Äò¬øpor qu√©?‚Äô ‚ÄòPorque perdimos‚Äô‚Äù, recuerda.
Hab√≠an migrado a Chile, Ecuador, Per√∫ y Colombia, y con el rev√©s de los comicios tras volver a Venezuela, tomar√≠an ahora rumbo al norte, hacia Estados Unidos.
Crisis pol√≠tica y migratoria, unidas
El presidente de Panam√°, Jos√© Ra√∫l Mulino, centr√≥ esta semana su discurso ante la Asamblea General de la ONU en la crisis migratoria en el Dari√©n, y su relaci√≥n con la situaci√≥n pol√≠tica y econ√≥mica en otros pa√≠ses como Venezuela, por lo que advirti√≥ que no se puede solucionar un problema sin resolver el otro.
Pero esta crisis viene de lejos, y desde hace a√±os se ha visto reflejada en el n√∫mero de venezolanos que atraviesan el Dari√©n, que son mayor√≠a.
En 2023, se produjo el r√©cord hist√≥rico de migrantes que atravesaron el Dari√©n, con m√°s de 520,000, el 63 % de ellos fueron venezolanos, seg√∫n datos oficiales proporcionados por las autoridades paname√±as, un porcentaje que se mantiene tras la crisis electoral del pasado julio.
En agosto, el √∫ltimo mes con datos completos, Panam√° registr√≥ 16,603 llegadas, de los cuales el 70 % eran venezolanos, mientras que en agosto de 2023, de los 81,946 migrantes que atravesaron el Dari√©n, el 76 % eran del pa√≠s suramericano.
Estos datos reflejan una abrupta ca√≠da de casi el 80 % en el n√∫mero de migrantes que cruzaron el Dari√©n entre agosto de 2023, el mes con m√°s llegadas en un a√±o r√©cord, y agosto de este a√±o.
El Gobierno de Panam√° atribuye este descenso a las medidas adoptadas para reducir el flujo migratorio desde su llegada al poder y estima que en 2024 unos 320,000 migrantes atravesar√°n esta selva ‚Äîcon m√°s de 260,000 ya en lo que va del a√±o‚Äî, lo que representa una reducci√≥n del 38 % frente al r√©cord de 2023.
Entre las medidas implementadas se incluy√≥ el cierre de algunas trochas con alambradas y un acuerdo con Estados Unidos, firmado el 1 de julio, en el que Washington se comprometi√≥ a financiar vuelos de repatriaci√≥n con un apoyo inicial de 6 millones de d√≥lares.
El primer vuelo, con destino a Medell√≠n, parti√≥ el 20 de agosto con una treintena de migrantes colombianos deportados. Desde entonces, al menos 12 vuelos han repatriado a 473 migrantes de Colombia, Ecuador e India, mientras que los venezolanos contin√∫an sin ser deportados debido a la falta de acuerdos entre Venezuela y Panam√°.
Miedo a las deportaciones
Los migrantes no ocultan el miedo a la deportaci√≥n, un temor que no exist√≠a en el pasado, cuando en general todos continuaban sin trabas su camino hacia Estados Unidos. Algunas familias han sido separadas. Franyelis C√≥rdoba es venezolana, su pareja Brayan Pineda, colombiano.
C√≥rdoba detalla que incluso fueron a un notario antes de iniciar su viaje para demostrar que viv√≠an juntos en Colombia, pero que cuando llegaron al centro de migrantes, a Pineda le quitaron su documento de identidad, se lo llevaron y tras un examen biom√©trico le dijeron que regresara a la ma√±ana siguiente.
Pero ¬´en la tarde lo vinieron a buscar, que recogiera todas sus pertenencias, y se los llevaron en un cami√≥n, sentados como si fueran unos delincuentes¬ª, relata, lamentando que su pareja, futbolista sin ning√∫n antecedente criminal, asegura, hizo el viaje por el Dari√©n porque ella no pod√≠a tomar un avi√≥n por venezolana.
La pareja de colombianas Laura Valentina P√©rez, de 22 a√±os, y Yuru Yiseth Rubio, de 32, tambi√©n dicen que a ellas las tuvieron ‚Äúm√°s tiempo de lo normal‚Äù durante los controles de seguridad de migraci√≥n, temiendo una posible deportaci√≥n.
Dejaban pasar a las familias, y a ellas no. ¬´Nosotras incluso nos sentimos discriminadas porque igualmente las dos est√°bamos pasando como pareja¬ª, explica a EFE P√©rez.
Est√°n instaladas en la entrada de una peque√±a tienda de campa√±a, sudorosas bajo el sol de la ma√±ana, despu√©s de haber dejado Colombia, un pa√≠s donde hay ‚Äúmuch√≠sima discriminaci√≥n‚Äù hacia los homosexuales.
¬´El tema de que te est√©n persiguiendo, el tema de que quieran abusar de ti porque (est√°s con) un sexo igual al tuyo, porque piensas diferente, todo eso nos hizo huir¬ª, sentencia Rubio.

author: Staff Reporters
title: Women in the Church 'continue to experience micro-aggression' says Bishop of London
text:
Wednesday 19 February 2025
Fractious Synod debate held on the diversity of the vacancy-in-see committee
The Bishop of London, the Rt Revd Sarah Mullally, presents the motion, on Friday
‚ÄúWOMEN‚ÄôS voices continue not to be heard‚Äù in the Church of England because of institutional barriers, the Bishop of London, the Rt Revd Sarah Mullally, has said.
During a fractious debate at the General Synod on Friday on proposed changes to make-up of the vacancy-in-see committee, she said that women ‚Äúcontinue to experience micro-aggression‚Äù.
Each diocese is required to have a vacancy-in-see committee, which meets only when the Bishop of that diocese has vacated the post, whether in the event of translation to another see, retirement, resignation, or death.
The committee holds at least two meetings, the first of which is held as soon as practicable after the vacancy has been announced. At its second meeting, the committee discusses the needs of the diocese before preparing a statement setting out those needs, which is sent to the Crown Nominations Commission (CNC), which is responsible for the appointment of the next Bishop. The committee elects by ballot from amongst its members persons to be members of the CNC.
The changes being put to the Synod last week were brought forward with reference to a review, published last year, of the appointment of the Rt Revd Philip North as Bishop of Blackburn (News, 19 April 2024). The reviewer, Maggie Swinson, had found that the process had been followed correctly, but recommended that the appropriateness of a suffragan bishop in the diocese chairing the vacancy-in-see committee be reviewed.
In accordance with this, one of the changes that Bishop Mullally proposed was to mandate that the chair be elected from among the lay members of the committee. This, she told the Synod, would avoid the risk of other members feeling unable to speak their mind because the chair was their line manager, or in another position of authority.
Other proposals were aimed at ensuring ‚Äúbetter representation of the diocese as a whole‚Äù on the eventual CNC, Bishop Mullally said. This included a requirement that at least one woman was chosen to be among the six diocesan representatives on the CNC, and that two members of the vacancy-in-see committee could not be connected with the same parish.
During the debate, many spoke in support of the motion, including Nadine Daniel (Liverpool). She also, however, that her diocese ‚Äúhas a problem‚Äù with its CNC, and that this would not be addressed by the proposed changes.
‚ÄúThat problem is that there is somebody who cannot be trusted to maintain their oath of confidentiality,‚Äù she said, referring to a recent leak about the appointment process of Dr John Perumbalath to the see of Liverpool (News, 7 February).
Several amendments to the main motion were brought, including one from Jennifer Fellows (Gloucester) that sought to remove the requirement for at least one lay person and at least one cleric from those elected from a vacancy-in-see committee to the CNC to be female. While she wished to see female clergy better represented, and more in the top jobs, the proposed change failed to address issues of women not being listened to, she argued. ‚ÄúWe can still enthusiastically pursue and empower women to become part of the process.‚Äù
In a key intervention, Bishop Mullally reminded the Synod that there had been no women on the vacancy-in-see committees in Durham, Exeter, and Coventry, and only one in Winchester, Sodor & Man, and Ely.
‚ÄúWomen‚Äôs voices continue not to be heard,‚Äù she said in growing frustration. ‚ÄúWhy are we not ensuring that our members are 50 per cent men and 50 per cent women? Even if we only have two possibilities, we still have four who are men.
‚ÄúThere continue to be institutional barriers. We continue to experience micro-aggression,‚Äù Bishop Mullally said, before, visibly emotional, she turned away from the podium. This was met with prolonged applause and a standing ovation. ‚ÄúPeople will say I have manipulated you,‚Äù she continued. ‚ÄúI have not manipulated you. . . Reject this amendment.‚Äù
The Revd Kate Massey (Coventry), said: ‚ÄúWomen are not another minority in the Church. We are a majority. We are subject to legal discrimination because of the bodies we inhabit. You need the voice of local women in your discernment. Every CNC includes a male priest, but not an ordained woman.‚Äù
The Revd Jo Winn-Smith (Guildford) said: ‚ÄúHere we are today debasing women. We are a majority in the Church‚Äôs congregations. I urge you to reject this.‚Äù
The Revd Kate Wharton (Liverpool) supported the amendment at one level: ‚ÄúI am a feminist and an egalitarian.‚Äù She was in favour of equal representation for men and women on all committees, but said: ‚ÄúWe should be beyond a time of reserving places for one gender. I want this clause not to need to exist. I want us to be better about changing our culture.‚Äù
THE behaviour of the House of Bishops had made her ‚Äúfurious‚Äù, the Bishop-designate of Aston, Canon Esther Prior, told the General Synod on Thursday, in a condemnation of its lack of consultation over proposed changes to Standing Orders relating to the Crown Nominations Commission
The Archbishop of York also wished this conversation was not necessary. ‚ÄúI wish we didn‚Äôt need any of those things, but we do, for the greater cause of unity and representation, and everyone feeling they have a place around the table.‚Äù
The amendment was lost in a counted vote by Houses. Bishops 1-18, with two recorded abstentions; Clergy 55-79, with nine recorded abstentions; Laity 68-90, with four recorded abstentions.
Other amendments lapsed as a consequence.
Returning to the main motion, the Revd Dr Charlie Bell (Southwark) said: ‚ÄúShow the Bishop of London a little more respect than comparing what she‚Äôs trying to do with Mugabe or South Africa. There has been so much talk about paying attention to power. This is being a bit ludicrous ‚Äî we are not listening to the voices of those who don‚Äôt believe they are being heard. Just vote the thing.‚Äù
Kenson Li (co-opted) was visibly impatient, too. He had been co-opted as one coming from a GMH background, he said. ‚ÄúSynod, if you think the system is working, don‚Äôt be surprised if they [young people] leave us. They will have made their minds up that this Church is not worth their time.‚Äù
The motion was carried in all three Houses. Bishops 16-3, with three recorded abstentions; Clergy 83-64, with four recorded abstentions; Laity 93-64, with no recorded abstentions.
Archbishop Cottrell moved: ‚ÄòThat the Vacancy in See Committees Regulation 2024 (Amendment) Regulation 2025, be solemnly affirmed and proclaimed in an Act of Synod.‚Äô
